text:
I have been carrying out some experiments with string interpolations, Markdown and mathematical expressions and I am encountering the following issue. In this example, depending on where I introduce the string interpolation, the $$..$$ block is printed or not. Is this the expected behavior? If this is the case, is it possible to get the $$..$$ printed in both cases? Thank you.
```julia> using Markdown

julia> func = md"$$y(x) = x^2$$"
  y(x) = x^2

julia> f = open("output", "w")
IOStream(<file output>)

julia> print(f, md"text then $func")

julia> print(f, md"$func then text")

julia> close(f)

shell> cat output
text then   y(x) = x^2
$$
y(x) = x^2
$$

then text```

elements.text: I have been carrying out some experiments with string interpolations, Markdown and mathematical expressions and I am encountering the following issue. In this example, depending on where I introduce the string interpolation, the $$..$$ block is printed or not. Is this the expected behavior? If this is the case, is it possible to get the $$..$$ printed in both cases? Thank you.

julia> using Markdown

julia> func = md"$$y(x) = x^2$$"
  y(x) = x^2

julia> f = open("output", "w")
IOStream(<file output>)

julia> print(f, md"text then $func")

julia> print(f, md"$func then text")

julia> close(f)

shell> cat output
text then   y(x) = x^2
$$
y(x) = x^2
$$

then text

text:
```julia> func = md"\$y(x) = x^2\$"
  $y(x) = x^2$                  
                                
julia> md"$func then text"      
  $y(x) = x^2$                  
                                
  then text                     
                                
julia> md"text then $func"      
  text then $y(x) = x^2$        ```

elements.text:
julia> func = md"\$y(x) = x^2\$"
  $y(x) = x^2$                  
                                
julia> md"$func then text"      
  $y(x) = x^2$                  
                                
  then text                     
                                
julia> md"text then $func"      
  text then $y(x) = x^2$

text: `$` is the interpolation character, so in `func` it interpolated things in a weird way, I think
